lines.content: Podz is a **task managing desktop app** designed to enhance your productivity with a blend Command Line Interface (CLI) efficiency and the user-friendly appeal of a Graphical User Interface (GUI). By seamlessly combining the benefits of CLI speed with the intuitive GUI, Podz empowers users to complete tasks effortlessly.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` or above installed.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for Podz.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the `java -jar podz.jar` command to run the application.
A GUI similar to the above should appear in a few seconds.
1. Type a command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
2. Refer to the [user guide](docs/README.md) for details of each command.
| Add deadline | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm]`  | `deadline return book /by 2024-01-05 1800` |
| Add event | `event DESCRIPTION /from YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm] /to YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm]` | `event project meeting /from 2024-02-01 1200 /to 2024-02-01 1600` |

Podz is a **task managing desktop app** designed to enhance your productivity with a blend Command Line Interface (CLI) efficiency and the user-friendly appeal of a Graphical User Interface (GUI). By seamlessly combining the benefits of CLI speed with the intuitive GUI, Podz empowers users to complete tasks effortlessly.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` or above installed.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for Podz.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the `java -jar podz.jar` command to run the application.
A GUI similar to the above should appear in a few seconds.
1. Type a command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
2. Refer to the features below for details of each command.
Shows a list of all tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Adds a todo task to the task list.
Sure thing! Added a new todo task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task to the task list. The time parameter is optional.
Got it! A new deadline task has been added:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a event task to the task list. The time parameter is optional.
Great choice! An event task has been added:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Great job! I've marked the task as complete. Keep up the good work!
Task status updated! The task is now marked as incomplete:
Deletes a task from the task list.
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Finds tasks that contain the given keywords.
Here are the tasks in your list:
It was a pleasure assisting you, Podz is here whenever you need help.
Podz can recognize shorter aliases for commands.
Example: `t` can be shorter alias for `todo`.
Task list data are saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that changes the data. There is no need to save manually.
| Add deadline | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm]`  | `deadline return book /by 2024-01-05 1800` |
| Add event | `event DESCRIPTION /from YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm] /to YYYY-MM-DD [HHmm]` | `event project meeting /from 2024-02-01 1200 /to 2024-02-01 1600` |
This user guide was inspired by the user guide of [AB3](https://se-education.org/addressbook-level3/).

* Represents a command to delete a task from the task manager.

* @param index the index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the delete command to remove a task from the task manager.
* @throws PodzException if the task index is invalid.
throw new PodzException("Oh no!!! Invalid task index!");
* Represents a command to add an event task in the task manager.
* Constructs an EventCommand object with the specified event task.
* @param event the event task to be added.
* Executes the event command to add an event task.
super.response = "Great choice! An event task has been added:\n"
* Represents a command to find tasks based on a keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand object with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for.

* Constructs an IncorrectCommand object with the specified exception.
* @param e the exception to be handled.
* Executes the incorrect command to print the error message.
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task manager.
* Executes the list command to display all tasks to the user.
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed in the task manager.
* Constructs a MarkCommand object with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to be marked.
* Executes the mark command to mark a task as completed.
* @throws PodzException if the task index is invalid.
throw new PodzException("Oh no!!! Invalid task index!");
super.response = "Great job! I've marked the task as complete. Keep up the good work!\n"
* Represents a command to add a todo task in the task manager.
* Constructs a TodoCommand object with the specified todo task.
* @param todo the todo task to be added.
* Executes the todo command to add a todo task.
super.response = "Sure thing! Added a new todo task:\n"
* Represents a command to unmark a task in the task manager.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand object with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to be unmarked.
* Executes the unmark command to unmark a task.
* @throws PodzException if the task index is invalid.

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefWidth="400.0" style="-fx-spacing: 10;" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/21" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">
